author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Road Show Asia 2015 to highlight Peru overseasTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Road Show Asia 2015 to highlight Peru overseas
Aimed at highlighting the country’s potential and consolidating Peru as the nation that offers the most attractive investment opportunities to foreign investors, the inPERU 9th Road Show: Asia 2015 will be held from September 7-11.
Non-profit association, composed of Peru’s most important business guilds, will participate in the Road Show.
Unrestricted access to most of the economic sectors will be introduced to Asian entrepreneurs during the event.
Despite current world economic slowdown, Peru continues moving forward thanks to its economic growth.
inPERU President Jose Antonio Blanco, indicated that tour’s objective is to promote and draw interest from Asian entrepreneurs by proving the South American nation is still one of the countries that ensures safer investments, since it “has the highest potential not only in the region, but in the [whole] world.”
The 2015 second road show expects to gather more than 1,500 foreign investors. Likewise, over 50 meetings are expected to be held.
Since its creation 2012, inPERU has visited 17 cities located in the Americas, Europe and Asia, ensuring the participation of at least 6,400 investors.
The Peruvian delegation -led by Peru’s Central Reserve Bank Governor Julio Velarde- will visit Tokyo (Japan), Beijing (China) and Seoul (South Korea).
The group will be composed of 30 people, among them relevant businessmen and other authorities.
